math_problem.A1618: Find all integers $n$ satisfying $n \geq 2$ and \(\frac{\sigma(n)}{p(n)-1}=n\), in which \(\sigma(n)\) denotes the sum of all positive divisors of \(n\), and \(p(n)\) denotes the largest prime divisor of \(n\).

math_problem.A1647: Let $n$ be an integer of the form $a^{2}+b^{2}$, where $a$ and $b$ are relatively prime integers and such that if $p$ is a prime, $p \leq \sqrt{n}$, then $p$ divides $a b$. Determine all such $n$.
